# Unsupervised Learning

## Required Packages
```{r}
  install.packages("clusterCrit")
```

## Load and scale data

```{r}
  data <- read.csv("../data sets/food.csv", row.names = 1)
  fds <- scale(data)
```

## Clustering
```{r}
  set.seed(123)
  kmc2 <- kmeans(fds, 2)
  ci2 <- clusterCrit::intCriteria(fds,kmc2$cluster, "Silhouette")
  ci2
  
  kmc3 <- kmeans(fds, 3)
  ci3 <- clusterCrit::intCriteria(fds,kmc3$cluster, "Silhouette")
  ci3
  
  kmc4 <- kmeans(fds, 4)
  ci4 <- clusterCrit::intCriteria(fds,kmc4$cluster, "Silhouette")
  ci4
  
  kmc5 <- kmeans(fds, 5)
  ci5 <- clusterCrit::intCriteria(fds,kmc5$cluster, "Silhouette")
  ci5
```
k = 4 has the lowest value out of the 4 options, so we will proceed with kmc4.
